vue-directives.name: v-kbd-trap
vue-directives.description: VueKeyboardTrap - directive for keyboard navigation - roving movement and trapping inside container

vue-modifiers.name: autofocus
vue-modifiers.description: Autofocuses the element with [autofocus] or [data-autofocus] attribute when the directive is mounted or enabled (only if it not covered by another element)

vue-modifiers.name: roving
vue-modifiers.description: Allow roving navigation (Home, End, ArrowKeys) - it's the same as using .roving.vertical.horizontal

vue-modifiers.name: vertical
vue-modifiers.description: Used with .roving - allow roving navigation (Home, End, ArrowUp, ArrowDown)

vue-modifiers.name: horizontal
vue-modifiers.description: Used with .roving - allow roving navigation (Home, End, ArrowLeft, ArrowRight)

vue-modifiers.name: grid
vue-modifiers.description: Used with .roving - allow roving navigation (Home, End, ArrowKeys) using dataset attrs on elements [data-${ camelCase from datasetName }-(row|col)]; [data-${ camelCase from datasetName }-(row|col)~="*"] is a catchall

vue-modifiers.name: tabinside
vue-modifiers.description: Used with .roving - Tab key navigates to next/prev element inside trap (by default Tab key navigates to next/prev element outside trap in roving mode)

vue-modifiers.name: escrefocus
vue-modifiers.description: Refocus element that was in focus before activating the trap on Esc

vue-modifiers.name: escexits
vue-modifiers.description: Refocus a parent trap on Esc (has priority over .escrefocus)

vue-modifiers.name: indexorder
vue-modifiers.description: When used without .grid modifier and on elements without [role="grid"]: force usage of order in tabindex (tabindex in ascending order and then DOM order)
